Errata

Errata for all patterns is listed below, with patterns in alphabetical order. Updates are issued to electronic purchasers as soon as the pattern has been updated.

If you find an error that is not listed on this page, please let us know!

Citizen Shawl

Version 3: error in set up.

Errors in
Version 3
Corrected in
Version 4
Error
Instructions state to increase to 248 stitches total. You should increase to 251.

Hey Jupiter

Verison 1: errors in Rows 8, 10, 12, 14.

Errors in
Version 1
Corrected in
Version 2
Error
Rows 8, 10, 12, and 14 of the chart are incorrect. Please follow the written instructions for these rows until a new chart is released.
Error
Row 14 in the written instructions omitted the final “k2”. Should read: k2, k3tog, yo, k7, yo, k3, k1tbl, p1, k1tbl, k3, yo, k7, yo, sssk, k2.

Luna's Shawl

Version 3: typos in the second table for stitch counts.

Errors in
Version 3
Corrected in
Not corrected.
Error
There is a series of typos in the second table, it shows even numbers starting at 50 when it should be showing odd numbers starting at 49.

Saroyan

Version 2: errors in symbol descriptions and custom sizing instructions.

Errors in
Version 2
Corrected in
Not corrected
Error
Symbol description, charts, pages 3-4.
Wherever it says "rhn", it should actually read "lhn" - this is in the description for all the bind-offs in rows 4 (left leaf) and 9 (right leaf).
Error
Custom sizing instructions.
In the written directions, it says "you have used 1/2 your yarn" and instructs you to begin decreases. However, if you are following the schematic you will see that decreases begin after you have used 72.5% of your yarn. You can start decreases anywhere in the pattern, as long as you have approximately 30% of your yarn left to complete the decrease section. (if you made an extra-large increase section, you must be sure to have the same quantity of yarn remaining that you used for the increase section).

Traveling Scarf

Version 3: error in main chart written instructions on Row 12 for worsted weight.

Errors in
Version 3
Corrected in
Not corrected
Error
Worsted weight main chart written instructions for Row 12 should read: k1, p13, k1.

Traveling Woman

Version 6 (ebook)/Version 8 (pattern): size Medium stitch counts and size Xlarge instructions.

Errors in
ebook version 6, pattern version 8
Corrected in
Not corrected.
Error
Medium only:
Instructions should end with 191 stitches, not 189 stitches.
Error
Xlarge only:
Instructions should read:
Next row: k3, yo, p2tog, p to last 5 sts (removing both center markers as you come to them), p2tog, yo, k3. (217 sts)

About pattern purchases

Patterns are sold as downloadable PDF files through Ravelry, with payments processed by PayPal. You do not need an account to use either service.

If you have a Ravelry account, I suggest logging in prior to purchasing so that patterns are added to your library.

Get pattern help

Pattern support is provided free of charge for all of my patterns. We respond as quickly as possible, but sometimes it can take a day or two.

Submit a new help request through Zendesk.

You can also use Zendesk to report errors and ask non-technical questions.

Alternatively, you can try the Ravelry group.

Support is only provided via Zendesk.

FAQ

Can I teach a class using your knitting pattern?

Teaching licensing is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

Can I sell items made using your knitting patterns for profit or charity?

Not at this time.

How do I order wholesale copies for my LYS?

Pattern wholesaling is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

I found an error, how do I report it?

Oh newts! Submit your error through Zendesk and we will fix it.

Happy knitting!
